main event: Two to three objects were spotted over Rydal, Georgia on November 10, 1951.
interesting points: The objects appeared at high speed, were very bright, changed course erratically, and disappeared suddenly.
The sighting was consistent with other Air Force sightings in the area, possibly of a meteorological nature due to heavy electrical storm activity in the vicinity at the time.
The pilot's flight testimony described the objects as dark to light blue in color, erratic in movement, and appearing to rotate.
The objects flashed on and off as though controlled by another light source, and a bright light appeared just over the top of the objects.
sighted object: two to three bright, fast-moving objects
